citations.narrative:
In the lower building, three guinea pig enclosures did not provide the required amount of floor space. On the right side of
the building, the second pen contained approximately 53 weanlings, and the seventh pen contained 51 weanlings. On the
left side of the building, the second pen contained approximately 51 weanlings. Each enclosure measured 2,100 square
inches of floor space and the guinea pigs, from weaning to 350 grams, require a minimum of 60 square inches of floor
space. Total floor space required to house these weanlings is 3,180 and 3,060 square inches, respectively. There cannot
be more than 35 weanling guinea pigs housed in an enclosure measuring 2,100 square inches.
Inadequate space can cause stress, crowding, and aggression in animals.
The licensee must ensure that all guinea pigs are provided with the minimum amount of floor space in order to avoid
overcrowding and to support the health and well-being of the guinea pigs.
Correct by: 9/15/2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
